intro: Eriogonum sarothriforme, commonly known as the Death Valley buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as deserts and rocky soils. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in the spring. Its leaves are generally gray-green with a fuzzy texture, and it has a deep root system that helps it survive in harsh, dry conditions. Eriogonum sarothriforme is adapted to extreme temperatures and is an important part of the local ecosystem.
